critique: The document is a recommendation for Mrs. Mary Elizabeth Porterfield to be appointed as an operative in the Bureau of Engraving and Printing of the Treasury Department without regard to civil service rules. This is based on the fact that she is the widow of Mr. James Porterfield, who served as a plate printer in the Bureau of Engraving and Printing for more than sixteen years and left his widow and two daughters without sufficient means of support.
